items.description: A long-sleeved protective garment worn over clothing in scientific and medical settings.
A full-body suit designed to protect against hazardous substances and environments.
A heavy apron made from flame-resistant material used in high-heat conditions.

phases.tip: Did you know? Lab coats are flame-resistant and protect against minor chemical splashes.

items.description: Protective eyewear designed to shield the eyes from liquids, dust, and debris.
Eyewear that reduces sunlight glare and protects from UV rays.
Glasses worn to correct vision deficiencies.

phases.tip: Safety goggles are designed with side shields, preventing liquid splashes from reaching your eyes.

items.description: Disposable gloves made of latex or nitrile, used to cover the hands.
Gloves made from wool, typically used for warmth in cold conditions.

phases.tip: Nitrile gloves resist punctures better than latex and are less likely to cause allergies.

items.description: Closed-toe shoes often used for casual or athletic purposes.
Footwear that exposes the toes, usually worn in warm weather.
Shoes with elevated heels commonly worn for fashion purposes.

phases.tip: Closed footwear should be made from non-absorbent materials.
